queries.query: <id ReturnTuple="1" Modifies="1" UnnamedVar="1" SuchThat="1" CondNum="4" RelNum="1" comment="double connected wildcard return syntax error <---- This should be a syntax error as double wildcard is not valid syntax">1variable v; Select v such that Modifies(v, __) SyntaxError SyntaxError 3.184000

<id ReturnTuple="1" Modifies="1" UnnamedVar="2" SuchThat="1" CondNum="5" RelNum="1" comment="double separated wildcard return syntax error <---- This should be a syntax error as double separated wildcard is not valid syntax">2variable v; Select v such that Modifies(v, _ _) SyntaxError SyntaxError 2.833000

query.querystr: variable v; Select v such that Modifies(v, "")
variable v; Select v such that Modifies(v, " ")
variable v; Select v such that Modifies(v, "_")

id.comment: Modifies spelled as ModifiesS return syntax error

query.querystr: variable v; Select v such that ModifiesS(1, _)

id.comment: Modifies spelled as ModifiesP return syntax error

query.querystr: variable v; Select v such that ModifiesP(1, _)

id.comment: both argument is wildcard return semantic error

query.querystr: variable v; Select v such that Modifies(_, _)

id.comment: argument 1 is wildcard return semantic error

query.querystr: variable v; Select v such that Modifies(_, v)

queries.query: <id ReturnTuple="1" Modifies="1" SuchThat="1" CondNum="3" RelNum="1" comment="argument 2 is non-variable synonym return semantic error <---- This should be a semantic error as second argument has to refer to a variable">10assign v; Select v such that Modifies(1, v) SemanticError SemanticError 2.842000

id.comment: undeclared synonym as argument 1 return semantic error

query.querystr: assign a; Select v such that Modifies(v, "x")

id.comment: undeclared synonym as argument 2 return semantic error

query.querystr: assign a; Select v such that Modifies(1, v)

queries.query: <id ReturnTuple="1" Modifies="1" SuchThat="1" CondNum="3" RelNum="1" comment="argument 1 using actual variable return semantic error <---- error not handled">0//variable v; //Select v such that Modifies("x", v)

<id ReturnTuple="1" Modifies="1" SuchThat="1" CondNum="3" RelNum="1" comment="valid meaningless query return all variables <---- valid meaningless query should return all variables">14variable v; assign a; Select v such that Modifies(7, "x")
